name: Gotyk House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Six rooms, built into the former home of Copernicus's lover... how unique can you get?
reviews.title: Unique & Cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a room at the top of the house, facing ul. Mariacka. The room was built into the roofline, so we had high, sloped ceilings and tiny windows looking out to the street - very sweet. The room and bathroom were spotless, staff were friendly, and everything was just as it should be.
reviews.title: Great stay and accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because of the way the house has been remodeled, noise echoes up the stairs, so you will hear people coming and going. Also, the bar across the street can be busy late at night. There are rooms at the back of the house, though, and those should be a little bit quieter.
reviews.title: amazing location and service, but no double bed in room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is just a 3-minute walk to the main square and all the popular Old Town sites.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect-gave you a real Polish feel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in the middle of old town and close to everything you want to see. Staff is very accomodating and offers a lot of information and places to see. Bathrooms are small but well equipped and all works great. Change and cleaning was done daily. The hotel has nice decorum and also a well equipped gift shop downstairs outside the building. Breakfast was served on time and had a good variety of local foods.
reviews.title: Fantastic service in perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gotyk House was the last stop on our 2-week Polish honeymoon. We arrived on Friday night to find that our name was not on their roster, though we'd paid in advance and booked a double room. Andrzej, the manager, was quick to realize the error, and then even quicker to give us the correct room and make our stay as comfortable as possible. He was an entertaining host with lots of stories and information about Gdansk, Copernicus, and Poland in general, and he did his best to make us feel welcome. The hotel even packed us a breakfast to go on our last morning when we had to leave at 4 am to catch a flight. The rooms are small but clean and pretty, the bathrooms are modern, and the house is on a wonderful old street right in the center of town. We would both return in a heartbeat, despite our rocky start.
reviews.title: Lovely end to a honeymoon in Poland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Gotyk House in Gdansk. I stayed with an elderly friend who required a downstairs room as there is no lift in the hotel. This was provided without question and the service throughout our stay was impeccable. The staff helped with making reservations for concerts and travel plans, had excellent English, and could not have done more to make our stay enjoyable. Our return flight to the UK was at the dreadful time of 6am yet the reception staff suggested a breakfast time of 3.30am !!! The location is terrific and the city is a wonderful place for a mini break. Affordable and well worth the awful flight times.
reviews.title: A little gem in the heart of the Old Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed here for three nights and would highly recommend it. The manager had a wealth of knowledge about local history and really points you in the right direction about things to see and do in Gdansk. Almost like a tour guide!
reviews.title: Beautiful little place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very pleasant and made you feel welcome. The breakfast was nice, and it's located on the nicest street you're ever likely to walk down!
reviews.title: Beautiful bed and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Two thumbs up!
reviews.title: Superb location, charming staff, excellent value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Booked as a 4 night stay and the place was as previously reviewed - an ideal position right in the centre of the old town, the owner Andre picked us up from the airport in the snow and filled us in on all the local history about the hotel and gdansk on our way to the Gotyk House. In the snow it looked so picturesque on arrival and the staff were always so friendly and to be of assistance. We were then when it was bitterly cold with a VERY keen wind and they were obviously having some problems with the heating. However, the rooms were great and we were given oil filled radiators in case we were not warm enough, together with cups of tea and coffee and the most delicious gingerbread (which can be purchased in the downstairs shop/museum /cafe). If you want a big posh modern hotel this is not for you but if you like small, friendly, decent continental breakfast, comfortable rooms in the centre of things this is the place for you. Nothing was too much trouble - ideas of which restaurant to eat in (and there are many good ones nearby) and which attractions to visit (some of which were not in the guide books). Because of a cancelled homeward flight we got a taxi back to Gotyk House and they took pity on us (and luckily they had cancellations because of the bad weather) and we ended up staying for an extra two nights. It was no hardship on our part. Thank you Andre and team, I hope to visit Gdansk again, maybe when it is a little bit warmer!
reviews.title: A little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Staff very friendly and informative. Room was quiet as I requested and very comfortable and clean. Location of Hotel was also excellent as very close to all attractions.
reviews.title: Friendly staff and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Owner of Hotel studied in Dublin and is very enthusiastic about his Copernicus Museum.
reviews.title: Lovely little hotel with the best possible location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a great place to stay and will return in the future.
reviews.title: Very friendly guesthouse on the best street in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent a very pleasant couple of nights staying at the Gotyk Hotel. The service was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel itself is very small as you will see as you enter the reception area. My room was very cosy, being a single, but when you are staying in what is a 16th century townhouse you cannot expect huge rooms.
reviews.title: A wonderfully quaint hotel in a beautiful location .. why book anywhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a Bed & Breakfast, make no mistake!!! But it is a wonderful Bed & breakfast! The staff is great, very thoughtful and were always ready with information, or willing to find you the information you are needing (we inquired about a ferry to Hel, and when we returned after sightseeing found a ferry schedule in our room!). The rooms are nicely furnished and are clean. Bathrooms are modern, but a bit tight. The bed, I felt, should have had a proper fitted sheet covering it. It only had two flat sheets to cover the mattress and they came untucked every night. The pillows were quite poor as well, one was feather the other was not. I got the non-feather one and it was fairly uncomfortable. :(
reviews.title: Thoughtful B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free Wi fi in the room, but no safe or hair dryer.
reviews.title: Can it be better?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast was so yummy! You tell the reception when you'd like to have your breakfast and then the next morning, you come down at that time and eat. Breakfast is: breads, meats, cheeses, assorted spreads, tea or coffee, veggies and gingerbread! We ate everything, every morning! You can even have your breakfast outside overlooking the beautiful Ulica Mariacka! The morning we left, we were given breakfast to go in a brown paper bag. We thought that was so thoughtful! Thanks!
reviews.title: Hidden Gem ?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location could not be better. Gotyk House is on a beautiful street full of Amber shops and next door to St. Mary's Church. Very short walk to the main square too.
reviews.title: A Gem of a Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 5 day long stay in Gdansk and was lucky enough to get a room at this tiny hotel after a cancellation by others. What a luck! We were picked up at the airport by a nice driver, taken to the hotel, given a room by a kindly girl who were there to help us all the way. The room was clean and whenever we asked for something all the staff members turned around trying to help us all the way. Super breakfast. Overall this couldn't be better. Top location, top service, top staff, top breakfast. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Fantastic Service, great location

description: Gotyk House is located in the very heart of the old town, in the most beautiful street in Gdansk. The oldest house A.D. 1451 was transformed into comfortable old styled hotel. Gotyk House is the place where modernity unites with history. The care of each and every detail of the house helps reflect the spirit of the past of old Gdansk in the interiors of Gotyk House. According to the legend this is the house where Nicholas Copernicus and Anna Schilling met and fell in love...
